bibl.title: P.Qasr Ibrim inv. 80/1: A Testimony to Zenodotos' Edition of the Iliad?
Papyrological Texts in Honor of Roger S. Bagnall

bibl.note: Scrap of papyrus found in 1980, possibly written during the short occupation of the place by the Roman soldiers in 22-21 BCE. One Homeric verse (Iliad V 31; cf. 455), written (at least) six times by the same hand. The papyrus presents a reading accepted by Zenodotos, as is testified by Scholia in Iliadem (Erbse) 5.31d. Not strictly a ""school exercise"", rather a model for writing down Homeric verse.
bibl.seg: 141.4 P. Qasr Ibrîm Inv. 80/1 = P. Bagnall 13
Tomasz Derda & Adam Łajtar, P.Qasr Ibrim inv. 80/1: A Testimony to Zenodotos' Edition of the Iliad?

Rodney Ast, Hélène Cuvigny, Todd M. Hickey & Julia Lougovaya (edd.), Papyrological Texts in Honor of Roger S. Bagnall = American Studies in Papyrology. 53 (Durham, North Carolina, 2013) pp. 75-78, 1 fig.

Scrap of papyrus found in 1980, possibly written during the short occupation of the place by the Roman soldiers in 22-21 BCE. One Homeric verse (Iliad V 31; cf. 455), written (at least) six times by the same hand. The papyrus presents a reading accepted by Zenodotos, as is testified by Scholia in Iliadem (Erbse) 5.31d. Not strictly a ""school exercise"", rather a model for writing down Homeric verse.
